title: Sylvester Stallone shows off pretty impressive guns for Halloween
text:
Sly has still got the action man vibe (Picture: Getty Images)

Sorry, but did Sylvester Stallone just take things back to his OG Rambo days?

The 73-year-old was preparing for Halloween this week alongside his 23-year-old daughter Sophia and we have to say there is a lot of epic attitude in this family.

It appeared the apple definitely didn’t fall far from the tree in the Stallone family, with Sophia seemingly dressed as boss action woman Lara Croft.

Made famous by Angelina Jolie and then with Alicia Vikander, Sophia donned a black tank, leather trousers and gloves as she got into character.

Even better though, was Sly, standing behind his daughter in full bodyguard mode.

Staring down the camera, the pair were a formidable force as the actor posted to Instagram.

He wrote in the caption: ‘@sophiastallone getting ready to channel LAURA CROFT Tomb Raider for Halloween, with some strange bodyguard lurking in the background…’

Yep, and he trolled his daughter at the same time. It really doesn’t get much better than this.

Sophia was picking up what her dad was putting down, as the commented: ‘Definitely my father’s daughter.’

Sly’s followers were living for the moment, as they took to the comments section and sounded off on the legend moment.

‘Tomb Raider and Rambo dad!’ one rightly pointed out, as another remarked: ‘Still got the guns, sly.’

Yes, he does.

Much like his action man compadre Arnold Schwarzenegger, age is but a number to the Hollywood stalwart.

Still making the bad guys quiver in his stunt-heavy films, Sylvester recently starred as Rambo in this year’s Last Blood.

No matter how impressive Sly’s moves may be, as he reprised his role as the legendary war veteran in the latest installment, directed by Adam Grunberg, it unfortunately failed to impress David Morrell who penned the original story.

Last month, in an email to Newsweek, Morrell explained that he felt ‘degraded and dehumanised’ after watching Last Blood at the cinema.

The author said: ‘Instead of being soulful, this new movie lacks one. I felt I was less a human being for having seen it, and today that’s an unfortunate message.’

In addition to the negative reviews, Last Blood has received a rating of just 30% on Rotten Tomatoes.

Sure it’s a run of harsh criticism but we can hardly imagine Sylvester – who’s reported to be worth $400million (£310million) – is letting it keep him up at night.
